message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering the sparsity pattern of an unknown sparse vector from a small number of noisy linear measurements, which is a fundamental problem in compressed sensing. The paper focuses on the high-dimensional setting and provides information-theoretic lower bounds on the measurement rate needed to attain a desired fraction of errors in the sparsity pattern estimate. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT), Signal Processing (cs.SP), and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the tightness of the bounds in a scaling sense, which may also relate to the Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) and Mathematical Modeling (cs.MM) sub-categories.
